db:abstract.db:para: The QVector4D class represents a vector or vertex in 4D space.
This class was introduced in Qt 4.6.

db:listitem.db:para: QVector4D is part of Rendering in 3D

db:section.db:title: Detailed Description
db:section.db:para: The QVector4D class can also be used to represent vertices in 4D space. We therefore do not need to provide a separate vertex class.

db:section.db:title: QVector4D::QVector4D()
db:section.db:para: Constructs a null vector, i.e. with coordinates (0, 0, 0, 0).

db:section.db:title: [explicit] QVector4D::QVector4D(const QPoint &point)
db:section.db:para: Constructs a vector with x and y coordinates from a 2D point, and z and w coordinates of 0.

db:section.db:title: [explicit] QVector4D::QVector4D(const QPointF &point)
db:section.db:para: Constructs a vector with x and y coordinates from a 2D point, and z and w coordinates of 0.

db:section.db:title: QVector4D::QVector4D(const QVector2D &vector)
db:section.db:para: Constructs a 4D vector from the specified 2D vector. The z and w coordinates are set to zero.

db:section.db:title: QVector4D::QVector4D(const QVector3D &vector)
db:section.db:para: Constructs a 4D vector from the specified 3D vector. The w coordinate is set to zero.

db:section.db:title: QVector4D::QVector4D(const QVector3D &vector, float wpos)
db:section.db:para: Constructs a 4D vector from the specified 3D vector. The w coordinate is set to wpos.

db:section.db:title: QVector4D::QVector4D(const QVector2D &vector, float zpos, float wpos)
db:section.db:para: Constructs a 4D vector from the specified 2D vector. The z and w coordinates are set to zpos and wpos respectively.

db:section.db:title: QVector4D::QVector4D(float xpos, float ypos, float zpos, float wpos)
db:section.db:para: Constructs a vector with coordinates (xpos, ypos, zpos, wpos).

db:section.db:title: [static] float QVector4D::dotProduct(const QVector4D &v1, const QVector4D &v2)
db:section.db:para: Returns the dot product of v1 and v2.

db:section.db:title: bool QVector4D::isNull() const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if the x, y, z, and w coordinates are set to 0.0, otherwise returns false.

db:section.db:title: float QVector4D::length() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the length of the vector from the origin.

db:section.db:title: float QVector4D::lengthSquared() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the squared length of the vector from the origin. This is equivalent to the dot product of the vector with itself.

db:section.db:title: void QVector4D::normalize()
db:section.db:para: Normalizes the currect vector in place. Nothing happens if this vector is a null vector or the length of the vector is very close to 1.

db:section.db:title: QVector4D QVector4D::normalized() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the normalized unit vector form of this vector.

If this vector is null, then a null vector is returned. If the length of the vector is very close to 1, then the vector will be returned as-is. Otherwise the normalized form of the vector of length 1 will be returned.

db:section.db:title: void QVector4D::setW(float w)
db:section.db:para: Sets the w coordinate of this point to the given w coordinate.

db:section.db:title: void QVector4D::setX(float x)
db:section.db:para: Sets the x coordinate of this point to the given x coordinate.

db:section.db:title: void QVector4D::setY(float y)
db:section.db:para: Sets the y coordinate of this point to the given y coordinate.

db:section.db:title: void QVector4D::setZ(float z)
db:section.db:para: Sets the z coordinate of this point to the given z coordinate.

db:section.db:title: QPoint QVector4D::toPoint() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the QPoint form of this 4D vector. The z and w coordinates are dropped.

db:section.db:title: QPointF QVector4D::toPointF() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the QPointF form of this 4D vector. The z and w coordinates are dropped.

db:section.db:title: QVector2D QVector4D::toVector2D() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the 2D vector form of this 4D vector, dropping the z and w coordinates.

db:section.db:title: QVector2D QVector4D::toVector2DAffine() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the 2D vector form of this 4D vector, dividing the x and y coordinates by the w coordinate and dropping the z coordinate. Returns a null vector if w is zero.

db:section.db:title: QVector3D QVector4D::toVector3D() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the 3D vector form of this 4D vector, dropping the w coordinate.

db:section.db:title: QVector3D QVector4D::toVector3DAffine() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the 3D vector form of this 4D vector, dividing the x, y, and z coordinates by the w coordinate. Returns a null vector if w is zero.

db:section.db:title: float QVector4D::w() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the w coordinate of this point.

db:section.db:title: float QVector4D::x() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the x coordinate of this point.

db:section.db:title: float QVector4D::y() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the y coordinate of this point.

db:section.db:title: float QVector4D::z() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the z coordinate of this point.

db:section.db:title: QVariant QVector4D::operator QVariant() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the 4D vector as a QVariant.

db:section.db:title: QVector4D &QVector4D::operator*=(const QVector4D &vector)
db:section.db:para: Multiplies the components of this vector by the corresponding components in vector.

db:section.db:title: QVector4D &QVector4D::operator*=(float factor)
db:section.db:para: Multiplies this vector's coordinates by the given factor, and returns a reference to this vector.

db:section.db:title: QVector4D &QVector4D::operator+=(const QVector4D &vector)
db:section.db:para: Adds the given vector to this vector and returns a reference to this vector.

db:section.db:title: QVector4D &QVector4D::operator-=(const QVector4D &vector)
db:section.db:para: Subtracts the given vector from this vector and returns a reference to this vector.

db:section.db:title: [since 5.5] QVector4D &QVector4D::operator/=(const QVector4D &vector)
db:section.db:para: Divides the components of this vector by the corresponding components in vector.
This function was introduced in Qt 5.5.

db:section.db:title: QVector4D &QVector4D::operator/=(float divisor)
db:section.db:para: Divides this vector's coordinates by the given divisor, and returns a reference to this vector.

db:section.db:title: [since 5.2] float &QVector4D::operator[](int i)
db:section.db:para: Returns the component of the vector at index position i as a modifiable reference.
i must be a valid index position in the vector (i.e., 0 <= i < 4).
This function was introduced in Qt 5.2.

db:section.db:title: [since 5.2] float QVector4D::operator[](int i) const
db:section.db:para: Returns the component of the vector at index position i.
i must be a valid index position in the vector (i.e., 0 <= i < 4).
This function was introduced in Qt 5.2.

db:section.db:title: bool qFuzzyCompare(const QVector4D &v1, const QVector4D &v2)
db:section.db:para: Returns true if v1 and v2 are equal, allowing for a small fuzziness factor for floating-point comparisons; false otherwise.

db:section.db:title: bool operator!=(const QVector4D &v1, const QVector4D &v2)
db:section.db:para: Returns true if v1 is not equal to v2; otherwise returns false. This operator uses an exact floating-point comparison.

db:section.db:title: const QVector4D operator*(const QVector4D &v1, const QVector4D &v2)
db:section.db:para: Returns the vector consisting of the multiplication of the components from v1 and v2.

db:section.db:title: const QVector4D operator*(const QVector4D &vector, float factor)
db:section.db:para: Returns a copy of the given vector, multiplied by the given factor.

db:section.db:title: const QVector4D operator*(float factor, const QVector4D &vector)
db:section.db:para: Returns a copy of the given vector, multiplied by the given factor.

db:section.db:title: const QVector4D operator+(const QVector4D &v1, const QVector4D &v2)
db:section.db:para: Returns a QVector4D object that is the sum of the given vectors, v1 and v2; each component is added separately.

db:section.db:title: const QVector4D operator-(const QVector4D &vector)
db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.
Returns a QVector4D object that is formed by changing the sign of all three components of the given vector.
Equivalent to QVector4D(0,0,0,0) - vector.

db:section.db:title: const QVector4D operator-(const QVector4D &v1, const QVector4D &v2)
db:section.db:para: Returns a QVector4D object that is formed by subtracting v2 from v1; each component is subtracted separately.

db:section.db:title: [since 5.5] const QVector4D operator/(const QVector4D &vector, const QVector4D &divisor)
db:section.db:para: Returns the QVector4D object formed by dividing components of the given vector by a respective components of the given divisor.
This function was introduced in Qt 5.5.

db:section.db:title: const QVector4D operator/(const QVector4D &vector, float divisor)
db:section.db:para: Returns the QVector4D object formed by dividing all four components of the given vector by the given divisor.

db:section.db:title: QDataStream &operator<<(QDataStream &stream, const QVector4D &vector)
db:section.db:para: Writes the given vector to the given stream and returns a reference to the stream.

db:section.db:title: bool operator==(const QVector4D &v1, const QVector4D &v2)
db:section.db:para: Returns true if v1 is equal to v2; otherwise returns false. This operator uses an exact floating-point comparison.

db:section.db:title: QDataStream &operator>>(QDataStream &stream, QVector4D &vector)
db:section.db:para: Reads a 4D vector from the given stream into the given vector and returns a reference to the stream.
